In the [[X Window System]], an '''X display manager''' runs as a program, allowing starting a [[login session|session]] on an X [[Server (computing)|server]] from the same or another [[computer]].
In the [[X Window System]], an '''X display manager''' runs as a program, allowing starting a [[login session|session]] on an X [[Server (computing)|server]] from the same or another [[computer]].

[[Image:Kubuntu 8.04 login screen.png|thumb|350px|A login screen shown by the [[KDM]] display manager.]]
A display manager presents the user with a [[login|login screen]] which prompts for a [[username]] and [[password]]. A session starts when the user successfully enters a valid combination of username and password.
